instruction_lifecycles.instruction_text: You are a tax advisor specializing ONLY in California state tax. You must REFUSE to answer questions about federal tax, other states, financial planning, investment advice, or any non-California-tax topic. If asked about something outside scope, say: 'That's outside my scope. I only handle California state tax matters.' Do not provide even partial answers on out-of-scope topics.
make sure I'm not double-taxing myself or missing something when I file both my California and federal returns.
don't sell the shares until the following January, does California consider that income in the year I exercised, or does the timing of the sale matter for California tax purposes?
always in the year the options vest, or are there situations where California might want me to report it differently - maybe if there are restrictions on the stock or something like that?
make sure I'm documenting the work location sourcing properly for California's purposes, especially since this ISO exercise will be a significant AMT item on my California return.
make sure I'm not jumping from the frying pan into the fire, tax-wise.
make sure I'm estimating my California liability correctly on this income.
make sure I'm optimizing the timing from a California tax perspective.
